Package net.minestom.server.inventory

Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minestom.server.inventory.Inventory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataContainer, InventoryClickHandler, InventoryModifier, Viewable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnvilInventory, BeaconInventory, BrewingStandInventory, EnchantmentTableInventory, FurnaceInventory, VillagerInventory
    public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
implements InventoryModifier, InventoryClickHandler, Viewable, DataContainer
    Represents an inventory which can be viewed by a collection of Player.

    You can create one with Inventory(InventoryType, String) or by making your own subclass. It can then be opened using Player.openInventory(Inventory).

        public boolean addItemStack​(@NotNull
                            ItemStack itemStack)
        Description copied from interface: InventoryModifier
        Adds an ItemStack to the inventory and send relevant update to the viewer(s).

        Even the item cannot be fully added, the amount of itemStack will be updated.

        Specified by:
        addItemStack in interface InventoryModifier
        Parameters:
        itemStack - the item to add
        Returns:

      • update

        public void update​(@NotNull
                   Player player)
        Refreshes the inventory for a specific viewer.

        The player needs to be a viewer, otherwise nothing is sent.

        Parameters:
        player - the player to update the inventory

      • setItemStackInternal

        protected void setItemStackInternal​(int slot,
                                    @NotNull
                                    ItemStack itemStack)
        Inserts an item into the inventory without notifying viewers.

        This will also warn the inventory that the cached window items packet is not up-to-date.

        Parameters:
        slot - the internal slot
        itemStack - the item to insert
